title: "Data sources"

One of the problem that our students here at Umeå face during their master thesis is finding relevant data. Hence here is a list of possible data sources collected with the help of my colleagues. I will try to keep this up-to-date.

## Micro data

[European Social Survey (ESS)](https://www.europeansocialsurvey.org/)

[Eurostat microdata for research](https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/microdata)

[World Bank Enterprise Surveys](https://www.enterprisesurveys.org/en/enterprisesurveys)

[Panel data research center at Keiko University](https://www.pdrc.keio.ac.jp/pdrc/ja/)

[IPUMS](https://www.ipums.org/)

[The Panel Study of Income Dynamics (PSID)](https://simba.isr.umich.edu/data/data.aspx)

[Public Use Microdata (PUMD)](https://www.bls.gov/cex/pumd.htm)

[China Family Panel Study (CFPS)](https://www.isss.pku.edu.cn/cfps/en/index.htm)

[easySHARE](https://share-eric.eu/data/data-set-details/easyshare)

[LIS](https://www.lisdatacenter.org/)

[Global Health Data Exchange](https://ghdx.healthdata.org/)

[International Household Survey Network](http://catalog.ihsn.org/catalog/?page=1&ps=15)

[The General Social Survey](https://gss.norc.org/)

[DHS Program](https://dhsprogram.com/Data/)

[UK data service](https://ukdataservice.ac.uk/find-data/browse/economics/)

[Consumer Expenditure Surveys (CE)](https://www.bls.gov/cex/data.htm)

[HFI, the Swedish retail research institute](https://hfi.se/working-papers/)

[Systembolaget](https://www.omsystembolaget.se/foretagsfakta/systembolaget-i-siffror/forsaljningsstatistik/)

[CESSDA](https://datacatalogue.cessda.eu/)
